plugins.name: Tabletop
plugins.description:
Play board games and card games, right in Figma! This plugin helps with card management, dice rolling, hidden information, and general usability.


Open the playground Figma file for pre-made cards, tokens, and dice!


Features

  1. Sneak a peek at any card or token by selecting it while it is face-down. You will get a preview of the front of the card in your plugin window.
  2. See how many objects you currently have selected.
  3. Flip any number of cards or tokens that you have selected.
  4. Roll any number of dice that you have selected.
  5. Stack objects - this aligns them horizontally and offsets them by 1px vertically, randomizes the layer order, and flips them face-down.
  6. Shuffle objects - this randomizes the layer order of every object you have selected.
  7. Expand a stack of objects - this lays them out side-by-side and flips them face-up, allowing you to quickly see all objects in a stack.
  8. When you select any object, automatically bring it to the top of the layer hierarchy so it appears on top of other objects.


Custom Card & Token Preparation

  1. Create a card or token component that contains a layer named "Front" and a layer named "Back".
  2. Duplicate the component into as many instances as you need for that particular card/token.
  3. Now you can use the Tabletop plugin to manipulate the instances of your cards or tokens!
  4. Optional: Export a PNG image of your "Front" layer, paste it into your component beneath the other layers, and rename it "Preview". This will speed up the preview image that is generated in the plugin when the object is selected.


Custom Dice Preparation

  1. Create a die component that contains at least 2 layers named "Face".
  2. Duplicate the component into as many instances as you need.
  3. Now you can use the Tabletop plugin to roll your dice!


Feedback Needed!

I'm actively working on this plugin, so please leave comments with feedback and I'll try to refine and add features accordingly.

accepted.name: Colin Brandt
accepted.description:
Full-time product designer at Microsoft
Free-time game designer

plugins.tagline: Play board games and card games, right in Figma! This plugin helps with card management and more.

plugins.name: TagIt: Tags Manager
plugins.description:
TagIt is a Figma plugin designed to streamline the process of organizing and managing tags for design elements within Figma documents.


Buy me coffee


  • Assign Tags: Easily assign tags to any node in the document, including frames, groups, or individual elements.
  • One-Click Selection: Quickly select all nodes associated with a specific tag with just one click, facilitating easy editing and synchronization.
  • Create and Edit Tags: Create new tags on the fly or modify existing ones to tailor the tagging system to your workflow.
  • Color Customization: Assign colors to tags for visual differentiation and organization.
  • Reorder Tags: Arrange tags in the desired order to maintain organization and hierarchy.
  • CSV Import and Export: Seamlessly import and export tags via CSV files for efficient bulk management.


Example Usage:

  • Tag multiple instances of a design element, such as "Primary Button" across different frames or groups.
  • Use TagIt to quickly select all "primary buttons" with a single click, facilitating swift editing and customization.

accepted.name: Sunny
accepted.description: Solving some of the use cases my team encounters when working in Figma.

plugins.tagline: Assign tags, find and select with tags, modify

plugins.name: Coordinate
plugins.description:
A simple plugin for quickly targeting nodes and extracting key positional data (X, Y, width, height) for use in other applications.


_Built using [The DataFace's Figma plugin template](https://github.com/the-dataface/figma-plugin-svelte-vite)_


How-to


1. Prefix desired nodes with a uniform string (e.g. `COORDINATE.` or `#` or `@`).

2. Once the plugin is initialized, enter that string in the search box (the default is `COORDINATE`) and run the command.

3. The positional data will show up below in the plugin's UI as JSON. You can download the results directly using the download button in the top-right corner of the results box.

accepted.name: The DataFace
accepted.description: A digital agency, specializing in data visualization

plugins.tagline: Extract coordinates from targeted nodes

plugins.name: Mermaid to FigJam
plugins.description:
## ✨ New Features


### FigJam → Mermaid Conversion

- **Section-based conversion**: Select any FigJam Section and convert all flowchart elements within it to Mermaid code

- **Smart node mapping**: Automatically generates clean, sequential node IDs (A, B, C... AA, AB... for 26+ nodes)

- **Shape recognition**: Correctly identifies rectangles, diamonds, and circles from FigJam shapes

- **Connection preservation**: Maintains all connections with labels and arrow types

- **Large diagram support**: Handles flowcharts with 100+ nodes efficiently


### Enhanced UI/UX

- **Dynamic button states**: FigJam → Mermaid button is enabled only when a Section is selected

- **Improved UI layout**: Cleaner interface with Sample Flowchart and Clear links

- **Real-time feedback**: Clear status messages for successful conversions

- **Bilingual support**: Works seamlessly with both English and Japanese text


### Technical Improvements

- **Robust error handling**: Graceful handling of edge cases and missing connections

- **Performance optimizations**: Efficient processing of large diagrams

- **Debug logging**: Comprehensive logging for troubleshooting (in development mode)


## 🔄 Conversion Capabilities


### Mermaid → FigJam (Enhanced)

- Automatic Section creation with timestamp

- Optimized layout algorithm with branch/merge point detection

- Smart connector routing to minimize overlaps

- Support for all Mermaid node shapes and connection types


### FigJam → Mermaid (New)

- Clean Mermaid code generation

- Preserves flowchart structure and logic

- Handles complex branching and merging patterns

- Maintains connection labels and directionality


## 📋 Usage


1. **Mermaid → FigJam**: Paste your Mermaid code and click convert

2. **FigJam → Mermaid**: Select a Section containing your flowchart and click convert

3. **Sample Flowchart**: Click to insert a sample Mermaid diagram

4. **Clear**: Reset the text area for new input


## 🛠️ Technical Details


- **Node ID Generation**: Intelligent mapping system supporting unlimited nodes

- **Shape Mapping**: FigJam shapes are correctly interpreted as Mermaid syntax

- **Section Detection**: Automatic detection of selected Sections for conversion

- **Color Scheme**: Light blue nodes (#C2E5FF) with blue connectors (#3DADFF)


## 🐛 Bug Fixes


- Fixed node positioning issues within Sections

- Resolved connector overlap problems in complex diagrams

- Corrected shape detection for rounded rectangles

- Fixed text encoding issues for Japanese characters


## 🔧 Requirements


- FigJam (Figma) desktop or web application

- Sections must be used for FigJam → Mermaid conversion


## 🚀 Getting Started


1. Install the plugin in FigJam

2. Try the Sample Flowchart to see the conversion in action

3. Use your own Mermaid code or convert existing FigJam diagrams


---


**Note**: This plugin is designed to work with standard flowchart patterns. Complex FigJam designs with custom shapes or annotations may not convert perfectly to Mermaid syntax.
plugins.tagline: Seamlessly convert between Mermaid code and FigJam diagrams. Code to visual,    visual to code.

plugins.name: Logo Light
plugins.description:
Transform Color Logos to Clean White Versions


Logo Light is a powerful Figma plugin that quickly converts any color logo or image into a clean, professional white version with transparent background—perfect for dark backgrounds, presentations, and mockups.


Key Features

✨ Instant Transformation - Convert any color logo to white with a single click

🖼️ Supports All Image Formats - Works with JPEG, PNG, SVG, and any other image format in Figma

📤 PNG Output - Creates clean PNG files with transparency for maximum flexibility

🎛️ Advanced Controls - Fine-tune the result with contrast and threshold adjustments

🔍 Preview - See your white logo in real-time against a dark background

🎯 Multiple Modes - Choose from three conversion methods for perfect results:


Luminance - Best for detailed logos with gradients

Silhouette - Ideal for solid logos and simple shapes

Threshold - Perfect for high-contrast conversion with clean edges


Why You Need This Plugin

Designers frequently need white logo versions for dark mode interfaces, mockups, and presentations. Instead of manually tracing or recreating logos, Logo Light automates this process with precise results in seconds. It works with any image format, including JPEG files that typically don't support transparency, and outputs clean PNGs with transparent backgrounds.

How to Use


Select any image or logo in your Figma document (JPEG, PNG, SVG, etc.)

Click "Generate Logo" in the plugin

Adjust settings to perfect the result

Click "Create in Figma" to add the white version to your document


The generated white logo maintains the exact proportions of your original and is placed right next to it for easy access.

Perfect For


Creating dark mode versions of websites and apps

Converting JPEGs and other non-transparent formats to clean white PNGs

Designing presentation templates with consistent branding

Building mockups with white logo variations

Preparing press kits with logo alternatives

Maintaining brand asset libraries with all logo variants


Feedback and Support

We're constantly improving Logo Light based on user feedback. If you have suggestions, encounter any issues, or need assistance, please reach out to us via our support email or website.

Transform your logos in seconds with Logo Light — the essential tool for every designer's toolkit!
plugins.tagline: Transform color logos to white with a single click

plugins.name: Button States Generator
plugins.description:
Enhance your design workflow with the Button States Generator and create consistent, accessible button components effortlessly.


Overview


The Button States Generator is a Figma plugin designed to streamline the creation of button components with multiple states: Default, Hover, Active, Focus, Selected, and Disabled.


Features


- Dynamic Button Creation: Generate button components with customizable dimensions, radius, paddings & colors

- State Variants: Automatically create and manage button states including Default, Hover, Active, Focus, Selected, and Disabled.

- Color Customization: Easily adjust each state colors, with options to randomize or reset to default.

- Contrast Checker: Built-in contrast checker ensures your design meets WCAG standards for accessibility.

- Icon Placement Options: Choose from multiple icon placement options (none, left, right, or icon-only) as a component property.


How to Use


Assuming you already have your button design ready:


1. Select button Frame: Start by selecting the frame of your button.

2. Customize Settings (optional): Use the plugin's UI to adjust dimensions, colors, and other settings if necessary.

3. Choose Icon Placement (optional): Select the icon placement option from the dropdown menu (none, left, right, or icon-only).

4. Generate Components: Click 'Create Component' to generate the button variants.


Note: This will not work if you select a pre-existing component. If your button is a component, detach it to convert it into a Frame.


Component Properties


The generated button component includes these useful properties:


- States: Choose between Default, Hover, Focus, Selected, and Disabled states

- Icon: Control icon placement (None, Left, Right, Only)

- Colors: Adjust text and background colors for each state

- Dimensions: Fine-tune sizing, radius and padding


Support


For any questions or support, please contact luc.hespel@gmail.com

accepted.name: Luc Hespel
accepted.description: UI / UX / IxD

plugins.tagline: Generate Button component with variants / states instantly

Features


- Dynamic Button Creation: Generate button components with customizable dimensions, radius, paddings & colors

- State Variants: Automatically create and manage button states including Default, Hover, Active, Focus, Selected, and Disabled.

- Color Customization: Easily adjust each state colors, with options to randomize or reset to default.

- Contrast Checker: Built-in contrast checker ensures your design meets WCAG standards for accessibility.

- Icon Placement Options: Choose from multiple icon placement options (none, left, right, or icon-only) as a component property.


How to Use


Assuming you already have your button design ready:


1. Select button Frame: Start by selecting the frame of your button.

2. Customize Settings (optional): Use the plugin's UI to adjust dimensions, colors, and other settings if necessary.

3. Choose Icon Placement (optional): Select the icon placement option from the dropdown menu (none, left, right, or icon-only).

4. Generate Components: Click 'Create Component' to generate the button variants.


Note: This will not work if you select a pre-existing component. If your button is a component, detach it to convert it into a Frame.


Component Properties


The generated button component includes these useful properties:


- States: Choose between Default, Hover, Focus, Selected, and Disabled states

- Icon: Control icon placement (None, Left, Right, Only)

- Colors: Adjust text and background colors for each state

- Dimensions: Fine-tune sizing, radius and padding


Support


For any questions or support, please contact luc.hespel@gmail.com
134571.release_notes: When your selected button is set to 'Hug' in auto layout width and height, the variants now follow the same rules.
134571.tagline: Generate Button component with variants / states instantly

plugins.name: Table text plugin
plugins.description:
Description

The Table text plugin allows designers to streamline the process of populating table components in Figma with comma-delimited data. Users can paste their data directly into the plugin’s interface, and the plugin will parse and populate the corresponding text layers in table cells. If additional rows are required, the plugin dynamically generates them based on the input data, ensuring a seamless fit within the existing table structure.


Key features

  1. Data input: Easily paste comma-delimited data into the provided text area. Supports handling data with embedded commas by using double quotes (" ") as delimiters.
  2. Dynamic row creation: Automatically generates new rows if the input data exceeds the existing table row count in Figma.
  3. Header matching: Maps data headers to corresponding Figma table cells based on their names, ensuring precise data alignment.
  4. Text layer updates: Identifies text layers named text within table cells and updates their content with the provided data.
  5. Guided setup: Includes a detailed Readme section to help users format data correctly and prepare their Figma file for efficient use of the plugin.


Best practices

  1. Prepare data in tools like Google Sheets and export it to a comma-delimited format.
  2. Ensure table headers in Figma match the column names in the data for accurate mapping.
  3. Define rows as local components in Figma and name them sequentially (e.g., Row 1, Row 2).


How to videos

I've created a series of video walkthrough to accompany the Figma playground file to highlight how the plugin works and how best to utilise it.

  1. Introduction
  2. Walkthrough
  3. Demo


Use the playground file to play with the capabilities of the plugin, as shown in the videos above.


This plugin simplifies data handling for table-based designs, saving time and ensuring consistency in Figma projects.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly transform CSV data into Figma table rows

plugins.name: Variable Agent
plugins.description:
Variable Agent

The plugin is designed to facilitate the management of variable collections within Figma. At the moment, it allows users to copy and paste variable collections, making it easier to manage design tokens and other variable data across different projects and files.


Current Capabilities

- View Variable Collections: Users can view all local variable collections available in Figma.

- Copy Collections: Users can select a variable collection and copy it to their clipboard.

- Paste Collections: Users can paste the copied variable collection into another document or project.


Steps to Use the Plugin in Figma

1. Open the Plugin: Launch the plugin from the Figma plugins menu.

2. View Collections: Upon opening, the plugin will automatically fetch and display all available variable collections.

4. Select a Collection: Use the dropdown menu to select the collection you wish to copy.

5. Copy the Collection: Click the "Copy Collection" button to copy the selected variable collection to your clipboard.

6. Paste the Collection: Navigate to the document where you want to paste the collection, launch the plugin, and click the "Paste Collection" button.

7. Check Status Messages: Monitor the status messages displayed in the plugin for feedback on your actions.


Limitations

- Draft file Support: If you copy a collection with multiple modes, and paste in a file in your draft, it won't work. This is because draft file only support 1 mode.


- Aliased variable collections: The plugin does not currently support pasting variable collections with aliased variables. Aliased variables are those that reference other collection. It will recognize the alias but will not be able to resolve the reference.

accepted.name: Raymond
accepted.description: Strategic Product Designer and Creator of Frames and Divs.

plugins.tagline: Copy and paste variable collection across files and projects

plugins.name: African Name Generator
plugins.description:
African Name Generator Plugin


What It Does

The African Name Generator plugin helps you quickly add authentic African names to your designs. You can generate and insert first names, last names, or full names from Nigeria, Kenya, Ghana, South Africa, and Ethiopia.


How to Use It

1. Open the Plugin: Find and launch the African Name Generator plugin in your Figma plugins menu.

2. Select Parameters:

- Country: Choose Nigeria, Kenya, Ghana, South Africa, Ethiopia, Egypt, Senegal, Uganda, Tanzania, Morocco, and Cameroon.

- Gender: Pick male or female.

- Name Type: Select first name, last name, or full name.

3. Generate Name: Click the "Generate Name" button. The name will appear in the plugin.

4. Insert Name:

- Select a text layer in your Figma file.

- Click the "Insert Name" button. The plugin will insert the name into the selected text layer.


Limitations

- Name List: The names come from a fixed list. Not every African name is included.

- Font Support: The plugin uses fonts available in Figma. Ensure the desired font is available.

- Single Text Layer: Insert names into one text layer at a time. Repeat the process for multiple layers.


The African Name Generator plugin allows you to easily add real African names to your designs.

accepted.name: Joseph Kalu
accepted.description: I am a fintech and crypto product designer

plugins.tagline: Generate Unique African Names for your designs

plugins.name: ASCII Art Generator
plugins.description:
Bring old-school, retro ASCII magic straight into Figma with the ASCII Art Generator plugin! Turn any image—portraits, logos, icons—into radiant text-based artwork inspired by classic terminal visuals.


  1. Subscription via plugin or one-time payment license
  2. Get one-time-payment lifetime license here ->


Key Features

Live Image Import

Upload any image (JPG/PNG) or paste a URL and instantly see it in ASCII form.


Full Adjustment Controls

• Brightness, Contrast & Blur sliders

• Invert toggle for negative‐style art


Rich Dithering Options

• Floyd–Steinberg, Atkinson, Ordered Bayer & Noise dithering

• Toggle “Ignore White” to preserve whitespace


Multiple Character Sets

• Standard (@%#*+=-:.)

• Block (█▓▒░)

• Binary (0/1), Hex (0–F)

• Custom “Manual” character

• Ultra-detailed glyph palette


Edge-Detection Modes

• Sobel outline for high-contrast edges

• Difference-of-Gaussians “DOG” contour style


Flexible Output Formats (Pro)

• Editable text node in Figma (pro)

• PNG export

• SVG code insert (pro) Vector outline (path-based)


Seamless Insertion

One-click “Insert” drops your ASCII art into the canvas, centered and ready to tweak.


Copy & Share

Copy pure ASCII text to clipboard or export vector/SVG code for use elsewhere.


Free Trial & License

• 2 free insertions under trial (PNG)

• Easy upgrade flow via in-plugin “Upgrade” (current user) or “Activate License” (1 or multiple one-time-payment) buttons

• Usage counter and “mouse-follower” overlay when trial ends

plugins.name: Clickma: ClickUp to Figma Sync
plugins.description:
Clickma eliminates rework and duplication by keeping design and project documentation seamlessly aligned in one unified workflow. It ties relevant ClickUp tickets directly to the Figma sections referenced, so Designers, Developers, Product Managers, and QAs can easily find what they need. See a video demo here.


Some key features include:

  1. Ticket import: Display Clickup Tickets in your Figma canvas.
  2. Jump to ticket: See all imported tickets in a list and jump to their location in your figma file.
  3. Search ticket in list view: Basic users can search by title and Clickup ID. Premium users can also search by Clickup status or assignee.
  4. DevMode Compatible: DevMode users can jump to ticket and see the list view.
  5. Sync tickets: Basic users can sync tickets individually, while Premium users can bulk sync tickets with just 1-click.
  6. Ticket link (premium): Open your tickets in your browser from list view, DevMode or the tickets you import.
  7. Edit tickets (premium): Edit ticket title, status and description within Figma and sync back to ClickUp.


Check more details our website clickma.tech


We are in active development, if you have suggestions for improvement, feedback or need help please contact us at support@clickma.tech

Generate sleek, customizable SVG QR codes in Figma! Free plugin with easy color, corner, and background adjustments. Perfect for professional designs.


🎨 Adjust colors,

🟪 Tweak corners,

💫 Fine-tune backgrounds,

🌈 Match your design style.



------------------------------------------------------



Plus UI QR Code Generator is a powerful and intuitive Figma Plugin designed to revolutionize the way designers create and implement QR Codes for Figma projects. Whether you need a Custom QR Code for a branding campaign, a digital product, or a marketing asset, this plugin provides everything you need, directly integrated into your favorite Design Tool.


With this Free Plugin, you can effortlessly generate SVG QR Codes, ensuring that every code you create is crisp, scalable, and ready for any digital or print application. The plugin offers a seamless Figma Customization experience, allowing you to adjust colors, shapes, and backgrounds to match your unique style. Create Colorful QR Codes that pop and attract attention, all while maintaining the integrity and professionalism of your design.


Plus UI QR Code Generator is ideal for designers working on projects that require advanced Branding elements. Whether you’re designing for a major marketing campaign, a sleek mobile app, or a company’s digital identity, this tool fits perfectly into any Design Workflow. Its smooth and intuitive interface allows for quick creation of professional QR codes, making it a must-have in any Digital Design toolkit.


One of the standout features of this Figma Plugin is its adaptability to complex Design Systems. If you’re managing a large-scale design project with multiple assets and components, you’ll appreciate how easily Plus UI QR Code Generator integrates with your existing system, helping you maintain visual consistency across platforms.


From enhancing User Interface designs with embedded QR codes to creating dynamic links for marketing materials, this plugin offers an effortless way to generate professional codes that align with your project’s aesthetic and functionality. Whether you’re crafting a digital business card, an event invitation, or a product tag, Plus UI QR Code Generator empowers you to create versatile, brand-consistent solutions.


In today’s fast-paced design landscape, efficiency and creativity are essential. This plugin streamlines the process of incorporating QR Codes for Figma, freeing you to focus on what you do best – designing beautiful and functional experiences. Say goodbye to generic QR codes and hello to stunning, customized solutions with Plus UI QR Code Generator.
